summary: This is the Fifth Amendment to the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust Two, executed by Jeffrey Epstein as the Grantor. It deletes a specific provision (Article FIRST (b)(viii)(B)) from the trust document and includes a notarization by Lauren J. Kwintner.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: He is the grantor who executes the Fifth Amendment to his trust, deleting a specific provision.

persons.name: Lauren J. Kwintner
persons.context: She notarizes the document, confirming Jeffrey Epstein's identity and execution of the amendment.

connections.description: Kwintner notarizes the trust amendment executed by Epstein, providing legal authentication.

events.title: Execution of Fifth Trust Amendment
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein executes the Fifth Amendment to his 2001 Trust Two, deleting Article FIRST (b)(viii)(B).

events.title: Trust Restatement
events.description: The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust Two was amended and restated.

events.title: First Trust Amendment
events.description: First amendment to the restated trust.

events.title: Second Trust Amendment
events.description: Second amendment to the restated trust.

events.title: Third Trust Amendment
events.description: Third amendment to the restated trust (this document).

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein amended his 2001 Trust Two multiple times, indicating active management of his financial assets.
The specific deletion of Article FIRST (b)(viii)(B) suggests a targeted change to the trust's terms, though the content is not detailed.
The document is formally notarized by Lauren J. Kwintner, a New York Notary Public, confirming its legal execution.
The trust was originally restated in March 2002 and had prior amendments in 2004, showing a pattern of revisions.
This amendment occurred in 2007, a period when Epstein was under investigation but before his 2008 plea deal.
